text: UPDATED: MAY 29, 2017 Bottle. Color: Dark ruby, bit hazy, frothy beige head. Taste: Rather complex mix of medium sweet and mildly sour notes, smoke, woody, hints of overripe red fruit (berries) and brown sugar. Dry mouthfeel at finish. Medium to full body, low carbonation. Very nice beer, unusual taste.

Bottled from HetBierMoment. Light brown colored, big beige head, nice. Strong smoky nose, roasted malts, impressive. Pleasant smoky flavor, roasted malts, substantially sweeter than the Schlenkerla beers, thick mouthfeel, remarkably complex for a 6.5% ABV beer. A new angle on the Bamberg smoky beers, i actually like it a lot.

Bottle, batch ALT-334 (from het biermoment). Pours dark amber with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is intense smoke, sausages, tar, malt, some fruits. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, smoke, malt, bacon, caramel. Finish is long sweet, fruits, and tar. Overall: good, but bit too sweet, also more smoked than alt.

33cl bottle at home. Somewhat pale brown with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice smokey bitterness with well balanced sweet tones. Roasted malts, caramel, smoke, bread and some peat. Nice!

Draught at De Wilde Hollander, medium slight ly dense creamy nocha head, cloudy very dark red color, aroma of smoked wood and caramel, slightly charred smoked wood flavor with caramel, dark bread and a hint of plums, lightish bitterness, light pleasant sourness. quite mellow. Good and enjoyable.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Roodbruin van kleur, wazig,  donker crèmekleurige schuimkraag.Aroma: Gerookte ham / gerookte mouten.....verder komt er geen aroma door.Smaak: Direct een sterk gerookte smaak, een priemend zuurtje, groene appel en zure bessen, een zoete karamel hint, donkere gerookte mouten, hout, as, licht bitter gehopt en iets kruiden.Body is vrij licht, koolzuur is rustig, na een paar slokken neemt het rokerige wat af en maakt plaats voor een moutige zoet.Afdronk is droog en toch nog vrij lang rokerig.Lang niet gek!
Bottle. Dark Amber color. Malty flavor with smoked mackerel.dryish. Beechwood. Smoked mackerel aroma. Medium bodied. Tasty. Good!

Bottle, pours ruby brown with an off white head. Smokey aroma with cedarwood, smoked sausage, caramel. Taste follows with some peat, earthy notes, red fruit, tea. Moderate sweet, moderate light bitterness, creamy texture, lingering finish that reminds me of lapsang souchong. Solid.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear dark brown colored brew with an dry bitter taste with some sweetness. Hints of caramel and the Bambergian smokiness. Bamberg meets Dutch Gelderland.
Clear dark ruby, light brown foam head. Smokey aroma and strong smoked taste. There is an ALt hidden in there. Quite nice. (Velp 201606)
Light brown colour. Aroma has light grass and smoke. Flavour is moderately smokey and has a malty sweetness in the finish.

Fast gone yellowish head over faintly veiled chestnut beer. Very nice, smoky/ smoked ham nose, orangezeste. Sweeter than Bamberger Rauchbeer, but still almost the same complexity as Schlenkerla. Light body, light slickness, undercarbonated. Quite good, if the body might have benefitted from a bit more beefing.

Bottle: Served in a taster:
Creamy head on top of a cloudy amber body.
Aromas of smoke, malts, flowers, leather...
Flavour is sweet ish with a good bitter tone. Sweet ish tint disappears right away. Light smoke, herbal, malty, light tobacco...
Aftertaste is bitter, light smoke, light herbal, light leather.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Nice beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 33cl bottle from trade with Douberd, many thanks! Pours clear reddish brown colour with a mid-sized beige head. Aroma of peated malt, dark malt, red fruits, mild hops. Taste of sweet mild roasted malt, some peated malt, wood, mild hops, interesting!

Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 25.03.16. Hazy copper. Dark beige head and lacing. Wonderful aroma of tar, creosote, lapsang souchong and burnt circuit boards. Taste is similar, but milder and balanced by sweetness. Quite dry aftertaste, with dark caramel malt.

Flaske fra Holmens importkoffert, delt med Ovesen mens vørteren koker: klar rødlig ravfarge med flott skum. Tydelig aroma av grunnsmøring for treski, kreosot og malt. Maltinnslaget blir tydeligere i smaken, så for meg som egentlig ikke liker øl med røykpreg er denne riktig så god. Mild, tørr bitterhet i avslutningen med et kledelig snev av bærsødme.

(Rodenburg Bronckhorster ALTernative) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into an altbier glass, ABV 6.5%
Brown coloured body, clear, with one finger of thick, tan head on top, with good retention.
Aroma of smoke, caramel, nice fruity notes underneath the smoke.
Taste has also smoke, more fruity now, caramel, light toffee, malts, light metallic notes on the finish with a good bitterness though.
Medium thin body with good carbonation, slightly sticky on the palate.
Nice.

Tap at cafe de Rat, Utrecht. Clear reddish amber with a small white head. Aroma of smoke, malts, caramel. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, light bitter, smoke, malts, caramel, light hops, aftertaste of sweet malts and light smoke. Not bad.

Sampled @ Pint Winterbierfestival Gouda, 2016. Clear medium to dark red color, average to medium sized beige head. Smell and taste firm smoke, sweetish, sweet malts. Medium body and carbonation. Meh, not my thing.

Thank you for sharing people! Sampled draft @ Gouda Winterbier Festival 2016. Dark brown amber with an off-white head. Nose is sweet smoke, huge meaty, plastic bacon qualities herbal. Taste is sweet basic sugar, smoked plastic, light smoked meat qualities, plenty of smoked qualities. Body is slick, herbal thick. A bit too-plastic like and simple but passable.

Pint Winterbierfestival, Gouda 2016. Gedeeld met de ratebeer clan! 
helder amber van kleur met licht kaki kraag. aroma van rookmout, zoet, caramel, mout. Smaken zijn matig zoet, zacht, vanille, waterig en wat dun, hout, rookmout, medium body, lage co2, zacht.

Tap sample at PINT Winterbierfestival 16. Dark amber colour, light beige head. Aroma is sweet, peat, smoky, fingerpaint, malts. Flavour is sweet, syrup, peat, smoke, fingerpaint, malts, nuts, bitter finish with some smoke. Light to medium bodied. Too sweet imho.
Bierfestival Delft. Amberkleurig. Zacht rokerig, houtskool, romig, caramel, cremig zacht.

Sample at Rootz beer festival. 
Smokey arpma. Hazy amber pour. Nice subtle smokey aftertaste.

Tap at Rootz Winterbier Festival. Pours clear amber with an off white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, smoked malts and a fruity touch. Flavour is over Moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter . Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap at NBF Delft. Clear reddish brown with off white head. Massive smoked meats, toffee, caramel, campfire, light cardboard, red apple, ash, some rotten leaves. Over medium bodied with slick feel and soft carbonation.

On tap at NBF Winter Delft 2015. Clear, dark reddish amber with a frothy, tan head. Sweetish-malty, smoky aroma of smoked ham, caramel and nuts. Sweetish-malty, smoky taste of smoked ham, charcoal, caramel and nuts, followed by a short, slightly bitter, smoky finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, flat. Very nice!
